DC2013_Chap04

Multiple Choice
Identify the choice that best completes the statement or answers the question.
 

 1. 
On which of the following are electronic components and most storage devices part of the system unit and do other devices, such as the keyboard, mouse, and monitor, normally occupy space outside the system unit?
a.
desktop personal computers
b.
notebook computers
c.
mobile devices
d.
Tablet PCs
 

 2. 
Which of the following is the main circuit board of the system unit?
a.
control board
b.
system board
c.
master board
d.
index board
 

 3. 
Which of the following interprets and carries out the basic instructions that operate a computer?
a.
control unit
b.
binary device
c.
CPU
d.
compressor
 

 4. 
With which of the following does the processor begin fetching a second instruction before it completes the machine cycle for the first instruction?
a.
clocking
b.
multi-core processing
c.
pipelining
d.
recatching
 

 5. 
One gigahertz (GHz) equals how many ticks of the system clock per second?
a.
one thousand
b.
one million
c.
one billion
d.
one trillion
 

 6. 
Which of the following is the most common type of volatile memory?
a.
ROM
b.
Flash memory
c.
CMOS
d.
RAM
 

 7. 
Current processors include advanced transfer cache, a type of cache built directly on a processor chip. Which type of cache is this?
a.
L1 cache
b.
L2 cache
c.
L3 cache
d.
L4 cache
 
 
 

 8. 
Which of the following means the computer automatically can configure cards like the one in the accompanying figure and other peripherals as users install them?
a.
concatenation
b.
GIGO
c.
daisy chaining
d.
Plug and Play
 

 9. 
Which of the following cards converts computer output into a video signal that travels through a cable to the monitor, which displays an image on the screen?
a.
output
b.
video
c.
express
d.
PC
 

 10. 
Which of the following determines the number of bits that the computer can transmit at one time?
a.
bus diameter
b.
bus width
c.
bus circumference
d.
bus interpolation
 
 
COGNITIVE ASSESSMENT
 

 11. 
When your friend opened the case containing the electronic components of his computer, he saw the main circuit board for the computer. What is this circuit board called?
a.
motherboard
b.
control board
c.
eectronic circuit primary board
d.
command board
 

 12. 
What are three names for the electronic component that interprets and carries out the basic instructions that operate a computer?
a.
analog interpreter, AI, interpreter
b.
CPU, processor, central processing unit
c.
control processing unit, CPU, processor
d.
command processing circuit, CPC, processor
 

 13. 
What are the four steps in the machine cycle?
a.
arithmetic calculations, comparison, storing, pipelining
b.
decoding, fetching, executing, controlling
c.
storing, executing, registering, cycling
d.
executing, fetching, storing, decoding
 

 14. 
Which of the following are the two leading manufacturers of personal computer processor chips?
a.
Intel and Quad
b.
Xeon and Intel
c.
AMD and Xeon
d.
Intel and AMD
 

 15. 
What numbering system uses only the numbers 0 and 1?
a.
octo system
b.
binary system
c.
8-bit system
d.
ASCII system
 

 16. 
When 8 bits are grouped together as a unit, how many individual characters can these 8 bits represent?
a.
8
b.
100
c.
256
d.
844
 

 17. 
What are the three categories of items stored in computer memory?
a.
operating system and system software; application software; data being processed
b.
system software; data being processed; Internet Web sites required to monitor and control the computer
c.
application software; application hardware; application data
d.
system software; application software; command software
 

 18. 
When determining the amount of RAM necessary for a computer you wish to purchase, what should you consider?
a.
the size of the computer monitor
b.
the number of expansion slots found in the computer
c.
the processing speed of the CPU
d.
the types of software you plan to use
 

 19. 
What is the term for an electrical channel within the circuitry of a computer than can transfer 8 bytes of data at a time?
a.
32-bit bus
b.
800 MHz circuit path
c.
64-bit bus
d.
system channel port (8-byte)
 

 20. 
In 1965, Gordon Moore, the cofounder of Intel, made a prediction that became known as Moore’s Law. What did the original Moore’s Law predict?
a.
The cost of computers would decrease by 25% each year.
b.
Computers would be in every household by the year 2007.
c.
The speed of computers would triple every two years.
d.
The number of transistors and resistors on a computer chip would double each year.
 

True/False
Indicate whether the statement is true or false.
 

 1. 
The case of the system unit is made of metal or plastic and protects the internal electronic components from damage.
 

 2. 
Each processor on a multi-core chip generally runs at a slower clock speed than a single-core processor.
 

 3. 
In the machine cycle, executing is the process of carrying out commands.
 

 4. 
Together, the four basic operations or a processor (fetching, decoding, executing, and storing) comprise a pipeline cycle.
 

 5. 
A petabyte is equal to approximately 1 million bytes.
 

 6. 
When the processor needs an instruction or data, it searches memory in this order: L1 cache, then L2 cache, then L3 cache (if it exists), then RAM — with a greater delay in processing for each level it must search.
 
 
 

 7. 
Some motherboards include all necessary capabilities and do not require adapter cards like the one in the accompanying figure.
 

 8. 
Buses transfer bits from input devices to memory, from memory to the processor, from the processor to memory, and from memory to output or storage devices.
 

 9. 
The larger the number of bits handled by the bus, the slower the computer transfers data.
 

 10. 
A DC adapter converts the DC power from the wall outlet into the AC power that the peripheral requires.
